name: Pierre Hotel Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Get this!
reviews.title: I'm so sorry

likes.liked: — the fact that a reservation DOES NOT mean reserved....it means we can book you elsewhere because we suck

reviews.text: Upon arrival and following confirmation of full air conditioning in all rooms, we were escorted to our room for nearly 10 minutes through a maze of hallways & stairs to a room actually outside of the main building in an adjacent structure. The room's air conditioning appeared to be on but the room remained stifling hot......as you always hope to avoid, an immediate call to the front desk to be moved.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel - great location

likes.liked: — Great location and friendly, helpful staff

reviews.title: perfect location
reviews.text: Able to move to a room where we would be assured of functioning air conditioning due to July temperatures in excess of 90f (of course, back in thier main building and a full mile closer to the lobby), we were given an acceptable room BUT they could only accomodate us for 1 of the 2 nights we had RESERVED. "We can arrange for another hotel Senoir".
Are you kidding me? We must of heard "Im so sorry" at least 25 times prior to actual check out the next morning.
reviews.title: Loved the Pierre

reviews.text: DO NOT utilize Hotel Pierre for your time in Florence.
reviews.title: Disappointed by the details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location location location! Cant beat it! Centrally located by the Ufizzi, the Duomo, Ponte Vechio is a short walk. Great shopping just one-two blocks away in each direction. We were greeted by a warm and friendly staff, Lucia is WONDERFUL! Rooms were very clean, air-conditioned (ours worked), bathrooms great size for Europe, and breakfast offered a great variety (fruit, yogurt, cereal, breads, cheeses, lunch meats & eggs-albeit powdered eggs). I would highly recommend it and is worth the price. You really can't beat this location & cleanliness of the rooms. Only 2 somewhat NEGATIVE comments: noise & internet service. First, it gets a little noisy at night (I was still able to sleep), but its somewhat expected given the fact you are in the heart of Florence. Also, the internet connection was not great, however at the cost of 20 euro for 24 anytime hours, it was certainly worth it.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: What a great location! My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Pierre in December as part of a working trip for me. It was right in the middle of everything, in an easy walking distance to everything. The Ufizzi, the Duomo, Ponte Vechio, great restaurants, really everything. When we got in we had just arrived from a flight from the US, then the train ride, we were exhausted and hungry and Lucia was an angel. She actually walked us to two nearby restaurants and talked to the people there to have them help us a little before their normal serving time, so, we could get to bed. She also booked us with the best tour guide at the Ufizzi gallery as we had forgotten that the weekend we were there was a bank holiday and was quite crowded. We were worried a bit as the first stop on our tour had no line whatsoever, but, it worked out great, and we just had an absolutely fabulous weekend. They really were all about customer service and soooo friendly. It could have been an act, but, really seemed sincere. Where in America will someone walk you anywhere to do you a favor? Not too many places!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!

likes.liked: — Location and friendliness of the staff
likes.disliked: — Beds weren't incredibly comfortable and the room was a bit hot.

reviews.text: The rooms were bigger than others I've had in Italy with a spacious bathroom and in the inside, very quiet and pleasant. In addition, when we called for our "American coffee" in the mornings it was there in less than 5 minutes. A great start to our days. The breakfast was ok, the typical Italian hotel staples, yogurt, granola, cappucino, but, a fine start nonetheless. The streets were all decorated for Christmas and lit up at night, it was quite something, a memory forever. Thanks Hotel Pierre!
reviews.title: loved the hotel

reviews.text: Can you say great location!!!! The hotel was located right in the middle of everything. The rooms were huge by Europe standards. The bathroom was even bigger. Nice amenities for the price. Hotel staff was terrific. They went out of their way to make sure we were happy and booked some extra tours for us no problem. Breakfastm was a little weak but everything else more than made up for it. I will reccomend this hotel to anyone going to Florence
reviews.title: Best location in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pierre for 2 nights during our 12 day trip to Italy in January. We arrived via train and was pleasantly surprised to find hotel is only 5 min from the station. We were even more pleased when we found that everthing else was equally close. Given that we only had 2 days in Florence, it was an ideal place to stay to see all of major spots in the city.(Uffizi, Duomo, Santa Croce, Ponte Vecchio, Accademia, Piazza Replublica, San Lorenzo market) Not to mention all the restaurants and shops near by. Hotel itself was also to our liking. Pretty good size room for Italy standard and the bathroom was definately bigger than average with double sinks and shower with tub. Breakfast was good and sevice was excellent. I have nothing bad to say about this place except that I wish we could've stayed a little longer.
reviews.title: the good and the bad

reviews.text: This is a classy hotel right in the middle of Florence downtown. The rooms are spacious as are the bathrooms which sport multiple sinks. The front desk gives great advice on tourist sites. However their advice on restaurants was only so so. The breakfast is wonderful as also the genral upkeep of the hotel. It is a little pricey but its proximity to all the tourist sites plus restaurants and shopping and other city action makes it worthwhile
reviews.title: Classy Hotel within walking distance of all major tourist sites

likes.disliked: — Difficulty in getting there by car

reviews.text: I booked the Hotel Pierre , not having been to Florence before. Now that I have been there I realize that the location was absolutely perfect - in the center of things, but quiet , a quick walk to the Duomo, Uffizi, steps from the Piazza Repubblica which was a great plaza full of restaurants and cafes, street peddlers with quality wares and on the weekend wonderful free entertainment ranging from opera singers to dancing. The hotel itself was very clean and well kept. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished and featuring hardwood floors, and the bath marble , spacious and clean. Laundry service was reasonable and fast.
reviews.title: Great hotel and good location!

reviews.text: The breakfast was above average for European breakfasts, offering yogurts, croissants, pastries, cheeses, cold cuts and fruit. Eggs are available at a small cost. The concierge was unusually helpful , assisting me in unusual requests as I was settling my daughter in for a year of schooling in Florence (and as a result came up with some unusual requests like the best company for a cell phone, somewhere to find a computer printer, and where to purchase scissors). The fellow called around for me, advised me of the best prices and places, made sure I went when the stores were open (Florence = nothing open on Monday mornings!) and was truly a godsend.
reviews.title: Loved Florence and the Pierre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. I might add that I ended up a few nights at the Hotel Baglioni, also a nice hotel but lacking the personal attention and concern that Hotel Pierre offers (the concierge wanted my room number before she would call a cab for me...) and it is also near the main train station, which, while convenient ,does not have the same ambience as the area near the piazza republica. So, when I go back to Florence, I will be back at Hotel Pierre.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Construction taking place across from the hotel

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Pierre. The room was wonderul and the bathroom was spectaular. The staff was wonderful and always helpful, especially one young lady at the front deak who could not have been any nicer. After four nights and a wonderful time it was hard for us to leave Florence. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt. You could not ask for a better location!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Pierre. It is in a wonderful location in the old part of Florence, just a few blocks from everything you want to see, from the Ponte Vecchio, to the Duomo, to the Basilica di San Lorenzo and the Uffizi gallery. We walked everywhere. The entire staff at this hotel was warm, friendly and most accommodating. Breakfast, which was included, was just what we needed to start our day. Our rooms, decorated in antiques were large with hardwood floors and the bathrooms spacious. Even though the hotel is in the center of things, it is on a side street, so our nights were very quiet. I had done quite a lot of research and it paid off. This is a wonderful hotel. My husband, my 12 year-old daughter, neighbors and their 13 year-old daughter, my sister and I were all very happy with our stay.
reviews.title: The Perfect Choice

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel in a wonderful location

reviews.text: We chose the Hotel Pierre for our December visit based on a recommendation from another forum and the hotel's superior location. We were not disappointed. The hotel is between the Ufizzi Gallery (and Ponte Vecchio) and the Duomo, and a short walk to the Accademia to see The David. From the train station it's a ten-minute walk. We walked everywhere--never needed a bus or taxi. There are good restaurants nearby and an Internet Train, and plenty of shopping in the piazzas. There's a travel agency right next door where we got tickets for our Eurostar trip to Rome.
reviews.title: Best location for first-time visitor to Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious and well-lit, with beautiful marble bathrooms. Each room has a lttle round table and two chairs in addition to the desk. Our rooms were on the inside of the building, away from the street, and very quiet. The breakfast was very nice, with a variety of fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, etc. and even scrambled eggs. The cappucinos were excellent too. The staff were helpful and friendly, especially Lucia at the front desk.
reviews.title: Hotel Piere

likes.liked: — friendly, helful staff and central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would choose the Hotel Pierre again and I highly recommend it for first-time visitors to Florence, or for anyone who wants a great value in a high-quality, centrally-located hotel.
reviews.title: Strengths and not-so-strong points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this small centrally located hotel in Florence (just north of the Ponte Vecchio). The room was very clean, of a decent size (as was the en-suite bathroom) and staff were extremely friendly. There is no restaurant in the hotel but no shortage of good restaurants within a few minutes walking distance; the Osteria del Porcellino (on Mercato del Porcellino) just around the corner was very good. This was our first trip to Florence (and Italy) but we intend to return and will definitely stay at the Piere next time. The only negative thing about our stay was the building work that started about 7am on the building opposite our window, but we could hardly blame this on the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

description: Magnificent palaces, splendid galleries, churches rich in treasures, artistic and architectural masterpieces. Few cities in the world can boast a similar variety of cultural offerings. Florence seduces and fascinates its visitors, leaving them with a strong desire to return.
